dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An UGLY MAN charges through on a horse, holding a lantern forward on a long pole. He looks back, terrified. INSERT TITLE:  1799 Sleepy Hollow, New York THUNDEROUS HOOFBEATS are HEARD behind. The ugly man glances back again.  His lantern swings wild SHATTERS against a tree.  The jammed-up pole SLAMS the ug man off his horse... He hits the ground.  He runs, trips, falls and scrambles DEEP IN THE FOREST, we glimpse the source of the HOOFBEAT HUGE FORM on a HUGE BLACK HORSE, already gone. The ugly man pushes through thorny bushes.  Jagged branch slit his hands and cheeks. He bursts from the briar patch and tumbles to a trail.  H lifts his bloodied face.  He runs. IN THE FOREST BEHIND: the hooves of the black horse rip underbrush.  HOOFBEATS DEAFENING.  A spur digs into the snorting steed's already bleeding flank. The pursuer's gloved hand draws a SWORD, blade RINGING. ON THE TRAIL, the ugly man runs on.  The shrill WHISTLE o SWORD SWING is HEARD as the pursuer blurs past. The ugly man is still running when his head lolls back, a impossible angle... tumbles off his shoulders... His head body hits the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty cobblestone streets.  Crooked buildings.  A RAPIDLY CLANGING BELL breaks the silence from afar. INSERT TITLE:  New York City TWO CONSTABLES clamor round a corner, lanterns held high, listening.  They rush into an alleyway. ELSEWHERE, piers border the Hudson River.  The BELL is LOUDER. The two constables arrive, searching.  No one aro Constable One hefts his pistol, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?! MAN'S VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here!  Over here! They hurry to the river's edge.  Down a hill, the MAN, another constable, stands with his back to us.  He's wais deep in water, tossing away his ALARM BELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help with this. Constable Two crosses on the peir above.  Constable One m forward, wary.  The MAN grunts, lifting something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable Crane?  Ichabod Crane... is that you? The MAN turns.  Meet ICHABOD CRANE, handsome, eyes pierci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is me.  But, not only me... (lifting, struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found someone here... He drags a bloated MALE CORPSE up from the murky water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone quite dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elderly HIGH CONSTABLE lifts a blanket off the corpse a wheelbarrow manned by Constable Two.  A snobby MAGISTRA looks, disgusted.  Constable One and Ichabod wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Constable Two wheels the corpse inside.  Ichabod's dismay

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a moment... if I may.  It is possible this man was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drowned.  Anyone could see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are surgical ways of telling how he died... by the water in his lungs... Ichabod follows the High Constable and Magistrate in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable Two wheels the body ahead past many "booking" tables.  A JAILER moves to unlock a massive door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will be burned pursuant to statutes of health.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could determine if he were dead before he went into the Hudson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must we again hear these heretical rantings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, must we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing heretical about science, sir.  The Chinese have written on it for hundreds of years... procedural study used to solve seemingly unsolvable crimes. The door is opened.  The corpse again leads the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A two-tiered prison, alive with MOANS of AGONY and CRIES INSANITY.  Cells are full of wretched men in chains and i gags.  Many are against the bars, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our first night watch is adequate against fire and some violence, but if we were more often able to ensure justice, after the fact, then criminals would truly have something to fear from law enforcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have they nothing to fear presently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without disrespect, look around you. (motioning to cells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We overflow.  As do our courts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, with disrespect, Constable, if jails and courts overflow, it is testimony to success, not failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, how many innocents rot here? And, how many victims are buried without reprisal while guilty men roam our streets? The High Constable reaches a desk, taking a seat.  Guards wait to process beaten, bloody prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very few, if any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though I have seen confessions pried from the lips of the accused, often quite literally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For one who calls himself a Federalist, your mouth reeks of Republican liberalism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Liberalism.  Equanimity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to High Constable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, sir... might I suggest... The Magistrate WHISPERS in the High Constable's ear.  Ich notices with worry that Constables One and Two wheel the corpse onwards into another room. The Magistrate finishes.  The High Constable smiles faint

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ichabod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a farming community upstate, Constable... ten days journey north in the Hudson Highlands.  It is named Sleepy Hollow.  Within a fortnight, three persons have been murdered there. Each with their head lopped cleanly off. (holds up papers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elders of the Hollow have sent dispatches to me, requesting assistance, and now, just this very moment, I have chosen you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chosen me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These "methods" of yours... there has been no practical application.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for lack of trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so.  Granted.  And so you take your experimentations to Sleepy Hollow and catch the murderer who has tainted the place.  Bring him here to face our good justice. Will you do this for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallowing doubt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall, gladly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.  Then, you are excused till morning. Ichabod moves away, heading to where the corpse was taken

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and, Constable... (off Ichabod's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do make certain that you meet with success.  Otherwise... perhaps you should not come back at all. The High Constable smiles a sardonic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corpse burns in a raging furnace.  Flesh sizzles. Constable One pumps bellows which fan the flames.  Ichabo steps from darkness nearby.  He watches with bitter regre the corpse is consumed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Market town streets bustle.  Filthy.  Pigs roam free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decorated in Early-American Mad Scientist: books, papers jars of chemicals.  Charts of anatomy above a small bed. ICHABOD (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a day for such a sad farewell. But, this is goodbye, my sweet. At the window, Ichabod holds a bird cage with a red CARDI inside.  He opens the cage.  The bird flies free. Ichabod watches it go, then looks down.  A COACH halts in street below.  The forlorn DRIVER looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In motion.  Ichabod absently studies his hands, touching strange SCARS on both palms: evenly dispersed, tiny dots tissue.  Many scars. Ichabod lifts a LEATHER SATCHEL, checking its contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO FAMILIES of MIGRANT WORKERS travel a path, leading ov burdened horses.  Ichabod's coach approaches from the oth direction.  Ichabod looks out, unnerved. One GAUNT MAN watches Ichabod pass.  There is a dead, wor look in the man's eyes.  Others stare at Ichabod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod faces two massive, vine-covered PILLARS, unsure. turns to watch the driver lead the coach away. Ichabod walks between the pillars to a long straight road He does not notice, above: THREE DEAD RAVENS hang from a limb, twine wrapped round their necks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod walks on with baggage.  The square is empty, a CH and GRAVEYARD at one end.  The road ahead is bordered by businesses and homes. CONVERSATION DRIFTS from a tavern.  A criminal sits in stocks.  A quiet CRYING is HEARD.  Ichabod hears... He looks for its source.  It's from a window above, LOUDE SOUNDS like the SOBBING of an OLD WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ICHABOD'S P.O.V.: a BELLTOWER stands tall, like a mast po with a crow's nest basket atop.  There's a man in the bas and a huge BELL. Ichabod ponders this as he continues.  Ahead on a hill: t grand Van Tassel Manor House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MANY CHILDREN, in a circle, taunt a BLINDFOLDED YOUNG WOM spun round by the handsome, barrel-chested man, BROM VAN BRUNT.  A few YOUNG MEN and LADIES watch.  Brom releases woman.  Everyone quiets and avoids her searching hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is such a silly game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a sport and stop complaining. The woman moves to Brom's voice.  He backs away, flanked peers GLENN and THEODORE.  Children laugh. Ichabod enters, clearing his throat.  No one notices.  Th blindfolded woman keeps grasping.  One LITTLE GIRL sees Ichabod and goes to him, finger to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play along.  You must. She tugs him.  Before Ichabod can protest, he is placed i the blindfolded woman's grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, I have someone.  Am I finished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to tell who it is. The woman touches Ichabod's face.  He is uncomfortable, affected by this caress.  Brom watches jealously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least make a guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Is it Brom Bones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Miss... (takes her hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have a laugh at your expense. She takes the kerchief off to reveal a stunning beauty: KATRINA VAN TASSEL.  Ichabod tries to compose himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, I didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I am looking for Baltus Van Tassel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't heard your name yet, friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, unless your name is Baltus, you should not worry over mine. Brom grabs Ichabod's collar, pissed.  Ichabod's baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need some manners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brom! Brom looks at her, then reluctantly releases Ichabod. MAN'S VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, then... ? BALTUS VAN TASSEL, 45, has entered, a working-class aristocrat.  LADY VAN TASSEL, 40, stands behind, a mix of home-spun wife and well-kept lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you, sir? Ichabod's relieved to have a proper focal point.  Childre gather around Katrina and hide behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been sent from the city with a letter of introduction. I am told you offer me room and board. Ichabod hands over papers.  Baltus reads, furrows his bro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we could speak alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, looks to Katrina)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a time for frivolity, Katrina, is it?  Am I mistaken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're only children, father. Baltus snorts, then exits with Ichabod.  The others huddl gossip, except Katrina, who moves beside Lady Van Tassel watch Ichabod and Baltus walk down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR LANCASTER, 50, dour and always sweaty, takes a sea the fire, joining Baltus and three other elders.  A prett servant, SARAH, brings a pipe cradle while Lady Van Tasse sets down food.  Ichabod is standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That will be all, ladies. (waits as they exit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are joined by Doctor Thomas Lancaster, Constable.  And to his left are, Clergyman Steenwyck and our able magistrate, Samuel Philipse, both keeping order in their own ways. PHILIPSE is youngest, eyes bloodshot, mug in hand and pip mouth.  CLERGYMAN STEENWYCK is formidably built, wearing constant look of disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I myself am in charge of financial matters and the regulation of currency in our commonwealth.  And, lastly, this fine fellow is James Hardenbrook, our Notary. HARDENBROOK is oldest, ancient, with one eye pale and bli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An honor, gentlemen.  In time I will need every detail of the three murderings you've had, but, for now, I ask only if you have any theory at all as to who the killer might be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, is there any one person suspect in these acts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid of this. Philipse shoots a look to Baltus.  Angst amongst the elde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Constable... are you aware... to be honest, you are not what we expected.  We sent for the militia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The militia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not tell us what you have heard? Hmm?  How much have your superiors bothered to tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is three are slain, their heads found severed from their bodies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heads were not found severed. The heads were not found at all. Withered Hardenbrook leans forward, his voice cragged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taken.  Taken by the Headless Horseman.  Taken back to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have not been well informed of our troubles, sir.  If you would... Baltus gestures for Ichabod to sit.  Baltus lights his pi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman... he was a Hessian mercenary, sent to our shores by German princes to help keep Americans under the thumb of England.  However, unlike his compatriots who came as muscle in trade for currency, he came willingly.  For love of carnage.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The HESSIAN HORSEMAN rides his black steed into a gory, close-quarters clash, his cloaked uniform adorned with ed weapons.  He cuts down Americans left and right. BALTUS (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was infamous for taking his horse, Daredevil, hard into battle... chopping off heads at full gallop. He dismounts, hoisting a battle axe.  With sword and axe, annihilates.  Blood gushes.  Bones crack. BALTUS (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to look on him made your blood run cold, for he had filed down his teeth to rapiers... to add to the ferocity of his appearance. The Horseman lets out a war cry.  Jagged teeth.  Grotesqu

dialogues.speaker: FOREST BATTLEFIELD
dialogues.text: Winter.  CANNONS can be HEARD BOOMING from afar.  Daredev lies dead in red snow.  FOLLOW FOOTPRINTS away... BALTUS (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would not finally meet his end till the winter of seventy-nine, when New York City was held by Henry Clinton and Washington occupied West Point.  It was between those two places, not far from here... The Horseman flees, cloak flowing, chased by FIVE rag-tag REVOLUTIONARY SOLDIERS.  Ahead, a steep, rocky area preve escape.  Soldier one aims a rifle and FIRES... Blood explodes from the Horseman's arm as he runs.  His s falls from his now functionless hand. Soldier Two grabs the sword. At the rocks, the Horseman faces the men.  Another Riflem raises his rifle.  The Horseman reaches over his shoulder grasp a sheathed knife, THROWS -- THOCK!  The Rifleman jerks back, knife in his eye socket. The Horseman readies an axe.  The Revolutionaries move in with swords.  They battle, STEEL AGAINST STEEL.  The Hors fends off blows from all sides. Soldier Three lunges, stabs his blade deep into the Horseman's side.  The Horseman roars, brings his axe DOWN BREAKS the sword at the hilt... An UPWARDS stroke sends Soldier Three head over heels in fountain of blood. The Horseman staggers, howling, trying to pull the blade his ribs.  The remaining soldiers close in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pipe smoke wafts from Philipse's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut off his head with his own sword. It's a legend told for twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, only recently has the Headless Hessian been seen prowling the Hollow, in search of a head to suit his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a moment... (sits back, incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying it is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aggravated, loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When a goblin leaps from the nether world, others follow.  Poltergeists of the air, water and earth follow and cheer his desecrations! Hardenbrook BANGS his cane on a table.  Baltus puts a cal hand on senile Hardenbrook's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one knows why he chose to now to climb out from his grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is very clear why.  Citizens here have long tried to hide sins behind closed doors.  Their failed faith has saturated the soil and called forth one of Satan's own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, gentlemen, but... who has seen this Horseman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, name one person who has seen him with their own eyes. A long wait.  No reply from the elders.  Ichabod rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I will do everything I can to find your assassin, I will look for a man of flesh and blood.  Not some goblin-demon from hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Belltower is covered in defensive spikes.  A man clim down a rope ladder.  Below, many ARMED MEN gather.  Every grim.  Philipse moves to the center, on horseback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gather round!  Gather and quiet! The hour has come to choose for this night.  Each man's name is in this box and has been checked. A box is handed up.  Ichabod and Baltus arrive on foot at back of the mob.  Ichabod looks... At a nearby forest, men light TORCH POSTS in a line borde the forest edge for at least a half mile. Philipse draws a folded paper from the box, holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May the Lord watch over him... (unfolds paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Jonathan Masbath."  Are you here? JONATHAN (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.  I take my responsibility. The crowd parts as JONATHAN MASBATH, a dirt-poor farmer w a bow and quiver of arrows, moves forward.  His son, YOUN MASBATH, 14, grips his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, father.  Wait... (up to Philipse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's already been up once.  Why does he go again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a lottery, son.  It just as easily might have been one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then... I go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You obey my wishes. (looks to crowd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brom.  Look after him, will you? Brom steps up, nodding.  Jonathan kisses his son's cheek, then heads to the rope ladder.  Men pat him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone leave him a horse. Young Masbath watches his father go.  Brom coaxes him awa At the back of the crowd, Ichabod watches skeptically, lo to Young Masbath as he and Brom pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worry for naught, little man. Nothing will harm him there. (looks up, sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is problems here on the ground you people need begin to worry about. Ichabod watches Jonathan climb, very high above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod makes notations in a LEDGER BOOK. KATRINA (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will dream. Katrina strolls in, sits on the bed.  Ichabod is nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they tell?  It is something in the air so that dreams come to everyone.  According to the elders, an Indian prophet held powwows here before the land was taken, and spells cast then still linger to this day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you often make a habit of sitting on strange men's beds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are horribly old-fashioned, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel free to form your own opinion. (facing his ledger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though it appears you already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I intended to apologize for the behavior of my friend Brom Van Brunt, but it seems I've made matters worse. (getting up to go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave you to your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... I should apologize.  I, um... I... have no great love of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might have been more.  Might have been positively grand talk. Ichabod offers his chair, backing away.  Seeing it is the only one, he remains standing.  Katrina sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it me, or are you this nervous around all women?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it is because your suitor's hands were recently very nearly wrapped around my throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My suitor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive fellow... Brom.  For someone you call "friend," he misplaces a good portion of jealousy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has proposed to me twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which may explain his temperament. To have asked twice means the answer was "no" at least once. Katrina looks down, discards this with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read a great deal about your New York City.  Do be a dear and tell me all about it.  Sounds like an extraordinary place to live a life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extra ordinary, yes.  But first, you tell me about the Headless Horseman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The torches burn bright.  ABOVE, in the Belltower, Jonath Masbath loads a rifle.  THUNDER BOOMS. Jonathan stands, looking to a sky that is all stars and m A HORSE is HEARD SHRIEKING.  Below, the horse tied at the base of the tower is spooked. A COMMOTION is HEARD, ground rumbling.  Jonathan grips a rifle, cocks it and moves to look... At the forest edge, a herd of deer stampedes out.  They sprint past the tower and across the field. Jonathan crosses to watch the herd scatter.  He crosses b to peer at the forest.  Bad news... A thick FOG creeps from the woods. As the fog overtakes the base of each torch, a tentacle o mist snakes up to the flame, killing it.  All along the forest, arms of vapor snuff torches... one by one by one. Above, Jonathan sights the rifle along the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come out, devil... come....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod leans on a dresser.  Katrina's still seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all think it is the Horseman. Many say witches come from the Western Woods to steal skulls for their cauldrons.  Some believe a person in this very town kneels before Lucifer, offering death as tribute.  And, still others believe none of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you so superstitious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To call a person superstitious is to imply they fear magic, but not all magic is black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no such thing as magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Then... what is your rebuttal to those romantic poets claiming proof of magic in a rose at full bloom, or even in a teardrop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poets have silly notions about plants and bodily secretions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are funny. Ichabod doesn't get what's so funny about that.  The DIST TOLL of a BELL is HEARD.  Katrina looks fearful. She goes to open a window.  The BELL TOLLS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... TOLLS mournfully over farms and forests...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... TOLLS as a MAN comes from his barn, listening, then sprinting towards his home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... TOLLS across the deserted square.  Windows go dark. Shutters are slammed shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... TOLLS.  Ichabod bounds out to the lawn, halting to listen.  Katrina and Baltus come out on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable, where are you going!? ... TOLLS... TOLLS... then, SILENCE.  Ichabod chases away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back, sir... (watches him go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madness. Baltus ushers Katrina back in.  The door slams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod charges across the rocky field.  He slows, awed.. The Belltower is down, its mast is splintered.  The horse gone.  Ichabod moves to where the crow's nest lies smashe No sign of Jonathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan runs past, gripping his bow.  It's QUIET... till HOOFBEATS are HEARD in pursuit. Trees are silhouetted against the sky.  As HOOFBEATS get LOUDER, branches bend like arms and fingers yearning to touch.  As HOOFBEATS ROAR PAST, the trees relax. FURTHER ON, Jonathan runs.  WIND begins to BLOW. BEHIND, in motion, WE SEE Daredevil's snorting visage; ey lizard-like, with vertical slits literally aglow. The Horseman's hand yanks a wooden WAR HAMMER from a sadd mount.  (No clear view of the Horseman.) HORSEMAN'S P.O.V.: closing in on Jonathan. Jonathan is overtaken.  The Horseman swings the hammer WH -- sends Jonathan sprawling. HOOFBEATS FADE.  Jonathan tries to get up, but pain shoot through him.  He crawls to retrieve his bow. Against a tree, he takes an arrow from his shoulder quive and readies it.  Waiting.  A metal TAPPING is HEARD O.S. CLINK... CLINK... CLINK.  A HORSE SNORTS. Jonathan pulls the bow taut, pained, lips bloody. Elsewhere, Daredevil approaches slow.  The Horseman taps sword on his spur, CLINK... CLINK... CLINK... Foliage moves as the Horseman's form pushes through. Jonathan releases -- the arrow WHISTLES... THWACK! -- imbeds in the Horseman's chest. CLINK... CLINK... CLINK... continues -- Jonathan readies second arrow.  Pulls and releases -- O.S. THWACK! CLINK... CLINK... CLINK... Jonathan cries out, crawling a desperately.  Crawling through underbrush, over roots and rocks.  CLINK... CLINK... CLINK... Jonathan gives up, spe face to the dirt.  He closes his eyes. CLINKING STOPS.  Daredevil halts astride Jonathan; two le on each side of Jonathan's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baltus and a large, DULLARDLY MAN ride.  Behind, Ichabod rides with Magistrate Philipse. Ichabod is not adept at riding his old nag, Gunpowder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Van Garretts died first; a man and his son, survived by a wife and two infants.  And the Widow Windsor was next...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Jonathan Masbath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks back, ponders)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he flee this direction, with so much open ground to cross before he reached cover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would not have gone into the Western Woods.  No sane man would. Philipse drinks from a whiskey flask, sees Ichabod watchi and offers some.  Ichabod declines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Ripper there... Ahead, the dullard, VAN RIPPER, sloppily spits tobacco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... found the body this morning. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do believe now, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said yourself.  What mere man could have downed the Belltower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a prime tenet of science, Philipse, that because one thing appears improbable does not mean you embrace the utterly fantastical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need less big words, and more common sense. Philipse fingers an IRON KEY talisman he wears on a cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that you wear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My talisman.  It will, protect against the Horseman if I show a brave face.  But, I cannot run.  If I run in fear, it is worthless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... so much for common sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brom and Baltus stand at a HORSE'S CORPSE amongst jagged boulders.  The flesh has been stripped, guts exposed. Philipse and Ichabod arrive and dismount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was this Jonathan's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Seems he panicked across here and broke two legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who took the meat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have been the Redman.  A Lenape Indian lives in the Western Woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These woods of yours sound a bit crowded, what with all the witches, ghouls and Indians living there. Brom climbs up onto his own horse, a black beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one Lenape.  He eats small animals and lost children... and the occasional constable when he can get it. Brom rides.  Ichabod goes to the dead horse, digs in his satchel for a thin iron tool, which he uses it to pry off HORSESHOE.  A WHISTLE is HEARD O.S. Everyone looks far ahead to where Van Ripper has ridden. doctor and others are there.  Van Ripper waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Lancaster stands with SEVERAL ARMED MEN.  A coffin a cart is covered by a blanket. Ichabod is crouched nearb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you move the body, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To place it inside its coffin. Ichabod, nods, vaguely annoyed.  He puts the horseshoe in hoofprint in the dirt.  It fits. Ichabod rises, walks, studying the ground, kicking up lea Brom, Van Ripper, Baltus and Philipse watch. Ichabod finds a deep hoofprint.  Huge.  He compares the horseshoe.  The hoofprint is much larger. Ichabod pulls his satchel off his shoulder, takes out a b bottle of water and bag of brown powder; begins mixing wa and powder with a fork to make plaster. The others watch, finding this bizarre, whispering.  Brom comes up to stand over Ichabod, irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the blacksmith.  Ever shod a horse with a hoof this large?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.  A shoe that size I would have remembered. Ichabod starts to fill the print with plaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Ripper.  Can you show where the body lay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can show exactly. Van Ripper dismounts, wiping tobacco drool.  Ichabod rise follow with his satchel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... in front of this oak, facing north.  Horrible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the best of your recollection, where did the open wound fall? Van Ripper points.  Ichabod takes a BOTTLE of WHITE POWDE from his pocket. He uncorks the bottle, cautiously pouring powder in an x the dirt there, then waiting. A chemical reaction causes the powder to bubble a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was not much blood, was there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see none. Ichabod stands, puzzled.  He walks to the coffin cart, rolling up his sleeves.  Others come to watch, but keep distance.  Ichabod removes the blanket... Reveals Jonathan's headless corpse. Philipse can't look.  Ichabod takes strange spectacles fr his satchel; wire-framed with many lenses.  MAGNIFICATION SPECTACLES.  He examines the gross neck wound, sniffs it. He pokes the flesh and severed spinal cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This should have bled by the pint. Yet, no blistering or scorched flesh. How... ?  Whatever weapon was used... it cauterized somehow.... Ichabod straightens, eyes weirdly big in the spectacles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It instantly burnt the wound shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coffin in a grave.  Headstone reads "MASBATH, 1799."  A CROWD gathered.  Young Masbath broods.  Clergyman Steenwy steps forward to take a handful of newly dug dirt. Men with guns stand at the outskirts, like on guard. Steenwyck sprinkles dirt into the grave with prayerful wo In the crowd people whisper.  They steal glances at Ichab who stands with the Van Tassels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dining room.  Sarah and two other servants collect plates few people still sup, including Van Ripper, his warty WIF and two kids.  Van Ripper guzzles ale, laughs at somethin his also-drunk wife says. IN the HALL and FOYER, funeral goers socialize quietly. FURTHER ON, in the SITTING ROOM, men smoke.  Young Masbat is confronting Ichabod, who is leaving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not here for revenge.  I am here to bring justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.  You still need a second to tend to your things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I manage fine alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I deserve to help you.  Don't you see how much this means?  My father... he... he was a good man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faces Masbath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Masbath, I am sorry for your loss.  It is a great and sad tragedy. However... I cannot be the one to look after you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not ask you to, did I? Young Masbath exits.  Ichabod remains impassive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod comes out.  KILLIAN, a dashingly rustic man, carr his son, THOMAS, 5, and chats with Baltus.  Doctor Lancas peers off at something through a SPYGLASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail, Constable.  How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well enough.  Your gathering does honor to the deceased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still using spyglass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must be a curious sight to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you spying on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offers the spyglass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lenape.  He comes to gawk at civilization from time to time.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Searching a line of trees and foliage far away... DOCTOR LANCASTER (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see the Redskinned bastard? There he is -- the LENAPE.  A towering savage with missha features covered in tumors.  He ducks away.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE ON PORCH
dialogues.text: Ichabod lowers the spyglass, a little awed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is a behemoth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A diseased monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you gentlemen will excuse the doctor and I... we have financial matters to discuss. Ichabod and Killian nod as Baltus and Lancaster head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Crane, sir.  I'm glad we have time alone.  You've been told plenty about the Horseman, I'm certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than enough, actually.  (tired laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg you, no more, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir, no.  If you ask me, I say you just laid eyes on our murderer through that glass. Ichabod ponders, folding the spyglass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something.  (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What becomes of Young Masbath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Ripper and his wife agreed to take him.  They have children and a good home and good land. Ichabod nods.  He turns to look THROUGH THE WINDOW.  In t DINING ROOM, Van Ripper rises, ill.  His wife questions h health, but he holds her off and vomits. Ichabod notes this with a deep sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ocher dusk.  Ichabod rides to Young Masbath, seated on th ground, miserable.  Young Masbath does not look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find yourself a place in the servants' residence and wake me before dawn. Our first task will be an unsavory one. Ichabod rides.  Young Masbath runs to his horse and follo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steenwyck is on horseback, looking down at Ichabod, furio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is sacrilege!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot proceed without examining the previous victims. Steenwyck looks to men with shovels.  Killian's there. Philipse, hung-over, stands beside Young Masbath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magistrate Philipse, surely you can stop this. Philipse just looks up with a helpless expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not allow it.  I will not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protest to my superiors if you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your superiors are two days away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, you should have left two days ago, because I have men willing to help me today. Ichabod motions.  Killian leads the men to the graveyard. Steenwyck watches, enraged.  He kicks his horse and rides Philipse looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PSALM is HEARD READ by STEENWYCK O.S. while a coffin is exhumed.  Ichabod guides the lifting.  The coffin is put the headstone "WINDSOR."  Ichabod looks... At the church, Steenwyck faces about fifty people who now take up the PRAYER. Across the cemetery, two coffins, one small, one large, a pried open.  "VAN GARRETT, 1799."  Killian leads the effo with Young Masbath's aid... The lids come off, revealing the HEADLESS BODIES of a MAN a little BOY.  Young Masbath backs away. At the "WINDSOR" coffin, nails creak as Ichabod opens the lid.  WE DO NOT SEE inside, but when Ichabod does, he is aghast.  He looks to the men, angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was I not told of this? No answer.  Killian arrives, nods solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Widow Windsor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all you say?  Look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not something people speak of openly.  She did not remarry. Ichabod kneels, studying.  Now, WE SEE: the belly of the headless corpse is bulbous, because the Widow Windsor was very far along in a pregnancy. Ichabod notices: a tear in the cloth of widow's blouse. reaches through the tear, feeling the stomach. He straightens, greatly troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scissors cut open the widow's blouse.  There's an inch-lo WOUND on the moldering belly; a sword puncture. Ichabod examines the corpse on a table.  Lancaster watche anxiously mopping his face.  Young Masbath's in a corner. Ichabod goes to write in his ledger full of notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the common thread between these victims?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must discover it.  The reason the murderer chose these persons. Ichabod goes to look at the widow's corpse, pondering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wounds are the same.  Cauterized. No chopping or half-measures either. One stroke took the head.  Have you seen, doctor... ? (pointing to it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the spinal bone... sliced as smooth as butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not care.  You are welcome to use my work area, but I beg you... return her to her resting place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In time, doctor.  Soon as I finish. Ichabod picks up an iron knife.  He looks to Young Masbat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should step outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and others restore graves.  Ichabod looks to the church, where Clergyman Steenwyck stands in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The devil sent you, Ichabod Crane. The Lord will not forgive your sins. Steenwyck shuts the creaky doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod sleeps, dreaming...

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: A young BOY, 10, stands in a wheat field with his back to A FEMALE VOICE is HEARD FAINTLY, getting LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod!  Ichabod... come along. The boy, YOUNG ICHABOD, turns, smiling.  He runs.  We FOL to a clearing behind a frontier home.  MOTHER waits.  Lov woman.  She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: Dark.  Young Ichabod, in bed, has one eye open.  Across t room, Mother has her back to him.  She's WHISPERING somet to no one.  She turns... Young Ichabod pretends he is asleep. A DRAWER is HEARD SHUTTING.  Mother exits.  Ichabod gets curious, opens a drawer... finds something behind clothin It's a piece of reed grass, woven into an elaborate patte with shafts of wheat twisted into the center.  Young Icha replaces it, closes the drawer.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: A busy, muddy street lined by wares and produce.  Young Ichabod walks with FATHER, an emotionless man.  Father st to examine tools.  Young Ichabod stays by him, but someth captures his attention... Across the way, Mother is involved in a argument with a FREAKISH-LOOKING WOMAN.  They shout.  People stop to watc Can't make out words, but Freakish Woman is furious.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING flashes over tree tops.  THUNDER BOOMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod jerks awake in his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod enters with a lantern and his ledger.  He sits, studies notes, then notices there's a light down the hall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opposite an elaborate loom, Katrina reads by candlelight. She looks up, seeing Ichabod enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry for disturbing you.  I thought a forgotten candle was burning. Katrina self-consciously closes her shabby book, puts it another on her lap and covers them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not disturb me.  Please stay. Having trouble sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask... why do you cover your book that way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pay great attention to small things.  I hide these as I hide all my books.  Father would not approve, lest it were the Bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, um... I have something to show you, if you have a moment. Ichabod sits, looking through his ledger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are strange... may I? She takes his hand, spreads the fingers to the palm.  She touches the many evenly spaced scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These scars.  How did you get them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have had them since childhood.  I cannot remember what from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be interesting to find out. Their eyes meet.  Ichabod gets back to the ledger.  Katri seems to relish the effect she has.  Ichabod finds a pape disk on string, illustrated thusly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is.  A bird on one side. His cage on the other.  Now, stare at it.  (spinning it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird seems to be in his cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he does.  May I try? Ichabod gives it.  She spins it, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He only appears to be inside the cage.  The point being...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made this, and the drawings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but listen.  The illusion is easily explained.  The eye retains each image, till they combine.  And yet, some would call this toy magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see why?  Look closely a moment.  Put your intellect aside.  (spinning it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you see what is inexplicable? Ichabod watches it spin.  He shakes his head, unimpressed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you are hopeless.  May I keep it at least?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want.  But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, I also have a gift for you. True magic which even you will not be able to deny. She hands him a book.  "ROMEO AND JULIET."  Ichabod stand offering it back, but she will not take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  No.  Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I insist that you have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned, leaving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well.  But, it will only sit gathering dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be a pity.  Those words might show you something you've never seen before. Ichabod stops at the door, looks back.  He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light glows in Ichabod's window.  LOOKING IN: Ichabod's bed, fully dressed.  He sits up.  Pause.  He crosses to p up "Romeo and Juliet."  He begins to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod walks with Philipse.  Young Masbath follows with horses.  CICADAS CHATTER from a vast corn field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not more than a year ago, a mob hung a man for stealing a horse.  For stealing a horse!  And, you dig up our dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying I should be frightened? Is this a message passed on from Clergyman Steenwyck? The CICADAS SUDDENLY go SILENT.  Young Masbath notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are farmers here, not lawyers or bankers, or even constables.  Every penny we earn comes from what we send down the Hudson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um.... excuse me, sirs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still to Ichabod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of the Horseman, our migrant workers flee for their lives.  There is a danger that our crops will rot. So, if you are going to help us, you stop the Horseman.  That is your task... to kill an undead thing. Young Masbath looks to a fenced grazing area, worried.  T sheep there are agitated, all running one direction away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to what you say....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you listen!  You may think we are a pack of superstitious dullards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At times I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sirs... please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will it take for you to realize this is no laughing matter? The horses go crazy, braying and rearing.  The reins yank Young Masbath off his feet as the horses flee. Ichabod and Philipse look to Masbath.  A SOUND is HEARD, distant: THUNDERING HOOFBEATS.  Wind kicks up.  HOOFBEATS seem to come FROM ALL DIRECTIONS. Philipse looks to the corn field.  A flock of birds aligh a great sheet of black against the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my... oh my oh my oh my... Philipse runs towards his house, past Masbath.  HOOFBEATS LOUDER, CLOSER.  Ichabod faces the corn field. The field explodes open, stalks bending to make way as th Headless Horseman gallops into view atop Daredevil. Young Masbath runs, following Philipse. Ichabod's stunned.  He looks down to draw his flintlock pistol, but the Horseman blows by before he can raise it. blast of air knocks Ichabod off his feet. The Horseman chases Masbath and Philipse. Ichabod follows. The Horseman draws his sword. Young Masbath falls in the grass... Daredevil's pounding hooves will certainly crush him. Daredevil leaps over Young Masbath, continuing the charge Philipse has a long way to go before home.  He looks over shoulder.  No way he'll make it. Ichabod, running, watches Philipse slow. Philipse gathers all his courage and stops, turning.  The Horseman is closing, sword held high. Philipse raises his talisman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philipse! Philipse holds the talisman up, trying to be fearless.  T Horseman swings -- WE HEAR the CLANK of sword on talisman Philipse's severed head spins.  His body falls and folds. Ichabod runs past Young Masbath. The Horseman halts just as Ichabod reaches a point in fro of dead Philipse, aiming his pistol.  Daredevil lets out SCREECHY CRY.  The Horseman rides toward Ichabod. Ichabod gets on one knee, trying to steady his pistol.  T Horseman closes.  Ichabod sweats bullets.  FIRES... The slug SLAMS the Horseman dead center -- bursts through rends his uniform without slowing him. The Horseman is almost on Ichabod.  Ichabod cringes, arms up... as the Horseman passes. The Horseman leans to skewer Philipse's head with his swo With the head as his prize, the Horseman races away. Ichabod gets up, watches the Horseman head to the forest. Ichabod looks to Young Masbath, finds his legs will not support him, falls, trembling.  THUNDER BELLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Van Tassel comes to a door, knocks.  Sarah stands be with a tray of food.  Young Masbath is seated near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Young Masbath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he not come out at all? Young Masbath shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNOCKING is HEARD.  Ichabod sleeps restlessly.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: THUNDER BOOMS.  WIND and POUNDING RAIN blast open a windo Mother comes to it, then moves to comfort fearful Young Ichabod in bed. MOTHER'S VOICE (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid... don't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: A keyhole.  Young Ichabod's eye peers in...

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: Mother is kneeled before flour on the floor.  She draws patterns in it, whispering.  She blows the flour away.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: The Freakish Woman (who argued with Mother) walks towards home, supported by a SAD MAN.  She weeps, carrying someth in a blanket. Young Ichabod comes a window, watching, scared. The Freakish Woman is so weak that she falls.  The blanke opens... the corpse of an infant tumbles to the dirt.  Th Freakish Woman's WAILING GROWS LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: TWO MEN in black drag Mother to a coach.  She looks back, fearful, pulled along.  A THIRD MAN in black follows. Young Ichabod struggles as Father restrains him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... mother... no... ! The Third Man peers back, a gray-haired, Cotton Mather-is man with a villainous face. FREAKISH WOMAN (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night of the great storm, I saw her cross my windows.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: Many people in the gallery.  The Third Man stands in fron the tearful Freakish Woman in the witness box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are certain it was she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lighting, I did see her. (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her.  Lady Crane... Mother sits in shackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will never forget.  The next moment, I found my infant dead... with the blood welt on his breast. Those in attendance cry out at this.  Ichabod is seated beside Father, eyes filled with tears.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: As before, a STORM RAGES.  Ichabod is in Mother's arms. FREAKISH WOMAN (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night of the great storm, I saw her cross my windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNOCKING is HEARD.  Ichabod gasps awake. KATRINA (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable Crane? Ichabod looks at his hands balled into fists.  He opens t -- has ONE HALF of PHILIPSE'S TALISMAN in each palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina holds a tray of food.  The DOOR is HEARD UNLOCKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina enters.  Ichabod sits at his work table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry? Ichabod shakes his head, won't look up.  Katrina crosses. She begins picking up pieces of the PLASTER HOOFPRINT CAS which lies shattered on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If these are the random stalkings of a monster, what good am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People have put their trust in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have done nothing of the sort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't they still have that justice? (patience waning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or, was it a vain promise? Ichabod stews, head in his hands.  Someone is HEARD RUNNING... Young Masbath enters, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable Crane... something has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lenape Indian hangs dead in a tree, lynched.  TOWNSFO are gathered.  Ichabod makes his way through, followed by Young Masbath, looking up. BROM (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do not need you, Constable... Brom strides towards Ichabod from a group of men spreadin sheet under the tree.  Van Ripper's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men who did this have been taken. We do not need you here. Brom points to where TWO FILTHY MEN in chains sit in a horse-drawn cart.  An armed man guards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should thank us.  The killings will end.  We saved you all! The armed man shoves the filthy man to shut him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spend two days in chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days... ?  For murder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For poaching.  Or, would you remake our laws now that Magistrate Philipse has given up the ghost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that look like an animal hanging?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like an Indian. Van Ripper cuts the noose rope at the trunk.  The Lenape corpse free falls, landing hard. The Lenape lies in a heap on the sheet.  Van Ripper and others come to lift the sheet with the Lenape in the midd Ichabod watches, noticing... The Lenape wears a WOVEN PIECE of REED GRASS a cord on hi loin cloth, twisted in a pattern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  Give me a moment... Ichabod kneels.  He removes the woven piece, looking acro the diseased Lenape's body.  Something else... The Lenape's mouth is agape; teeth rotting.  Ichabod look around, finds a twig.  He uses it to pull the Lenape's mo open... gets close to peer inside the Lenape's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DRAWING of the Lenape's WOVEN PIECE in Ichabod's ledger The piece lies near. Ichabod sits staring at it, trance-like.  Masbath waits. Long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lenape Indian had much to tell once I opened his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His teeth.  Someone had cut them and chipped off rotten pieces far back in his mouth.  The Lenape could not have done that for himself. (closes his journal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone out there cared for him. Ichabod rises, deciding.  He picks up his satchel and exi Young Masbath is surprised.  He follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive, wooden WINDMILL, raised off the ground on a 7' center post.  Ichabod and Masbath walk to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Young Masbath enter via a ladder from the underbelly.  Gears and counter wheels turn millstones.  A men work in the grain powder filled air. Ichabod leads the way to a staircase, up twists and turns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Young Masbath climb out a door to the roof. rotors spin nearby.  Ichabod searches the countryside. Below, MANY MEN are ride up the long straight road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's payment day.  Loan monies are given to Baltus the last day each month.  Almost everyone borrows... for tools or to hire workers. Ichabod sits, takes a bowl from his bag and gives it to Masbath, then produces a bottle of water... fills the bow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out there.  What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Western Woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look again. A plume of smoke rises from woods, far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke.  Chimney smoke. Ichabod holds a piece of straw in his mouth, rubs the poi of a sewing needle against a small BLACK ROCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you familiar with magnets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for eating, I assure you.  Watch here. Ichabod shows the magnet grab the needle.  Young Masbath amazed, reaching for it.  Ichabod watches him play with i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's spectacular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I suppose it is.  Keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I couldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have others.  All I need is this. Ichabod takes the needle, poking its butt end into the ti the straw.  Young Masbath studies the rock, pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, almost shy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, hold the bowl steady.  Back to business. Young Masbath lifts the bowl.  Ichabod drops in the needle/straw which floats and turns compass-like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the Western Woods are truly the Devil's Glen, we will see for ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father said witches live there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witches do not exist.  However... Ichabod uses a knife to notch the bowl lip where the need points, then surveys the smoke, making a second notch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not long ago, I would have said the same for Headless Horseman. KATRINA (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable... ! Katrina's on horseback below, unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to speak with you.  Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Katrina lead their horses.  A heated argument

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you do such a thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No stone may be left unturned.  It may appear harsh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have misjudged you I think.  I did not imagine you were so cruel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not regarding it in full. The Widow Windsor had been run through by a sword.  I followed the bloodless wound, a wound whose path I could not comprehend till I had seen the Horseman with my own eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you on about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child she carried was eight months grown at least... near to birthing.  The sword had pierced its tiny heart exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must I hear this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no blind stabbing.  This singular thrust found its target omnipotently, as if the Horseman made certain the unborn child died with its mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this gives worth to butchery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was not butchery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it then?  Scientific method? How can any of this matter in the slightest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no solution for its meaning yet, but I could not just ignore it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a lesson from Young Masbath's desires, Ichabod Crane.  He follows with you to avenge his father's death. That I understand.  But, what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To avenge his father, and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, why?  Tell me why. Ichabod struggles for a reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You falter with your answer because you strive without putting the whole of your heart into it.  Can't you see? You'll bring dignity to the dead even if you have to chop them into little pieces to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fed up, growing anger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it had been surgery on a living person, done to save that person's life, you would not question it.  Not for a moment.  So, let me be the first to tell you, dear girl... on the other side of these sheltering mountains, a whole world has advanced beyond such plebeian thinking as yours.  And someday, no matter how much you fear it, that world will come to roust Sleepy Hollow out of its slumber. Katrina storms away.  Ichabod's already regretting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Young Masbath ride to the Western Woods, hors loaded for expedition.  At the Belltower remnants, Ichabo slows, looking to the wreckage. At forest's edge, Young Masbath waits. Ichabod circles the tower.  With a sigh, he rides to join Young Masbath. They head into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, dense and creepy.  Ichabod and Young Masbath move through.  Young Masbath halts his horse and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listens, looks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No crickets or cicadas calling.  No bird songs. Stark quiet.  Ichabod notes this unhappily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod's hand drops the needle/straw in the water bowl. needle spins.  The bowl is turned to match notches. Ichabod points the way to Young Masbath. ELSEWHERE, SOMEONE WATCHES:  A MOVING P.O.V. WATCHES them they ride, FOLLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Masbath reach a hill crest.  They stop, uneas Below: a CAVE with a rock archway.  An ill-fitting door covers the mouth.  The chimney spews smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have apparently arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horses are tied to a tree.  Ichabod walks to the cave door.  Unsure, he hesitantly knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Young Masbath step in. Walls are hung with skins and skeletons, dry flowers and grass in patterns.  An OLD CRONE sits facing away. The old Crone, a mountain woman with matted hair and grey features, sits disinterested.  Ichabod edges closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon.  You did not answer when I knocked.  Are we intruding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are from the Hollow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way, yes. Ichabod looks at tables of gourd bowls of dead insects an acorns.  Knifes, scissors, yellow bones.  He takes the Lenape's piece of reed grass from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lenape who lived in these woods... do you know him?  The Redman? (uncomfortable wait)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should tell you... he has been murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me.  You are not welcome here. The old Crone places something on a table beside her -- a dead cardinal, bright red. Ichabod is afraid, backing away, but Young Masbath takes woven piece and steps to the Crone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you a friend to the Indian? (waits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have this... if you were his friend. Young Masbath puts the woven piece beside the cardinal. walks to join Ichabod in leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seek remedy against the Horseman? The Old Crone reaches to pick up the weaving.  She stands faces them.  Tall.  Ichabod nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Young Masbath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go out and keep away, child. (to Ichabod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay.  Follow with me. The Old Crone takes a candle and walks, deep into the cav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Crone comes through a passage in the wet walls. Ichabod enters, scared, bent under low ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear him.  He rides to the Hollow and back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman.  Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit. Ichabod sits on crooked stool.  The old Crone kneels with back to him, gathers straw in a pile on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to see into the nether world... I can show you.  Whatever you see, do not move or speak.  I will hold him. She gathers bowls, putting grass and powder on the pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns, furious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your mouth!  Keep silent. She takes two jars from a table, pours ashes on the pile one.  She shakes the other roughly, takes the lid off and upends it.  A baby bat squirms on the floor, dazed. The Old Crone holds the bat, using a knife to cut off its head.  She soaks the straw with blood, SPEAKING IN TONGUE guttural.  Using a wick, she lights the straw. She grasps two METAL CUFFS with chains attached, slides t onto her bony wrists, then bends to inhale smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes now. Ichabod would like to leave now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Masbath, waiting by the horses, looks up.  Through trees, black clouds billow and block the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old Crone slumps, still with her back to Ichabod.  Sh does not move.  Wind howls through a hole/window.  Rain. Candles blow out.  Ichabod stands, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... um... She remains motionless.  The STORM outside intensifies. WE SEE the skin of the Crone's wrists transform; swelling the cuffs, hardening, cracking and bleeding. Some thing Ichabod cannot see.  He inches closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright... ? The Crone turns, hideous, leaping erect -- a half-human, half-demon CREATURE.  Its black clawed hands reaching. Ichabod recoils, crying out. Chains on restraining cuffs yank the creature back. Ichabod hits the floor, knocking over a table of bones. creature is chained, but still wants Ichabod.  It SCREECH The Old Crone's face seethes from transformation, eyes bl red, nostrils dripping, teeth now jagged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seek the warrior bathed in blood... the Headless Horseman. Ichabod slides back as far as possible while the creature claws the rock floor, yearning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow the Indian trail to where the sun dies.  Follow to the tree of the dead. The creature pulls, testing the chains.  Behind, the BOLT holding the chains to the wall slips.  The wall cracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climb down to the Horseman's soulless place and let loose his silent shrieking.  Do you hear?  Do you hear?! Ichabod nods, quaking, aghast.  He glances to the exit. The chain bolt gives more... coming loose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He who holds fast the Horseman's desire will guide his reaping hand. Catch hold of his desire. Ichabod bolts for the door.  The creature HOWLS, leaping. The chain bolt breaks... Ichabod cries out, tackled to the floor... It is the Old Crone who landed on him.  She has returned human form, semi-conscious.  Ichabod shoves her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod runs out into the howling storm, past Masbath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Ichabod scrambles onto Gunpowder, heading further into th woods, glancing back.  Young Masbath follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No rain.  Dark.  A lantern's glow creates shifting shadow Ichabod and Young Masbath ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow the Indian trail to where the sun dies.  To the tree of the dead.  (looking back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we passed it by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could something named "the tree of the dead" fail to draw attention? A BIRD CRIES OUT.  Ichabod's startled, looking up.  The B is HEARD ALIGHTING.  Leaves float downwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should not go much further in this murk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we go back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are far from the Hollow.  (dismounts, troubled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loath to say it... better to get our backs against a tree and stay till morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horses are tied.  Ichabod is seated against a tree.  A campfire burns.  Young Masbath lies on a blanket, rifle c his chest, staring to treetops. Leaves and branches shift in the wind.  Bats fly wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it mean... climb down to the Horseman's soulless place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Let loose his silent shrieking." Who knows, till we work at it?  I admit not being anxious to find out. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "He who holds the Horseman's desire will guide his reaping hand." Whatever the Horseman's desire is, other than extinguishing lives. A SNAPPING BRANCH.  Ichabod raises his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Young Masbath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not move. Ichabod rises.  He creeps forward, pistol and lantern forward.  Foliage is thick.  CRUNCHING LEAVES are HEARD. Ichabod crouches, puts down the lantern and picks up a branch.  He tosses the branch to the foliage... SOME ANIMAL darts away, a running blur. Ichabod rises, following with his pistol. ANOTHER ANGLE, MOVING P.O.V.: low to the ground, moving swiftly at Ichabod... Ichabod spins, blindsided. Young Masbath fires his rifle -- CRACK!! The ANIMAL is KNOCKED DOWN mid-leap, yelping... The beast lands, a mass of grey fur. Ichabod comes to stare down.  Young Masbath arrives.  The both look to the beast, horrified. The creature lies helplessly spastic; a TWO-HEADED WOLF, one head blown open to brain and gore.  Its living head lifts, MEWING sadly, eyes pleading. Ichabod step up with pistol.  FIRES.  MEWING STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What God-forsaken hell is this? Ichabod swallows back sickness, looking away.  Something catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ... Through the forest: the SKY'S LIT UP.  Distant fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Masbath ride up, confronted by the Crone's ca vomiting flame out all orifices. Ichabod approaches.  Embers swirl everywhere.  The Old Crone's body lies amongst bloodied leaves.  Headless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much commotion.  A MOB in front of the home marked "LANCASTER, PHYSICIAN."  Steenwyck addresses the rabble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all stand idle, while this man goes about with a book of secrets and a bag filled with magic.  You all stand idle, while the shadow of the Devil falls over our town. Baltus, Lady Van Tassel and Katrina watch at safe distanc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, if you do nothing, you share in the blasphemy of Ichabod Crane! Killian, on horseback beside his wife, BETH, and son, Tho rides to one side of the shouting crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me!  Do you want to save your crops?  Or would you rather see your farms go to ruin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he saving our farms?  How? Ichabod Crane has brought into our midst the soulless, moldering corpse of a heretic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod examines the Crone's neck wound with magnificatio spectacles.  Young Masbath is seated, ledger in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wound is neither smooth nor cauterized, but jagged.  She bleeds like a fountain. Ichabod lifts her dead hand to show bruises and cuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did not go quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Lancaster wrings his hands.  His WIFE rocks nervou in a rocking chair.  The CROWD outside ROARS as a bonfire lights up the curtained windows. The front door is POUNDED open.  ANGRY MEN enter.  Lancas stands, lips quivering.  He points insistently to a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry men break in.  Ichabod looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step aside, Constable.  Step aside... Ichabod is shoved aside, spectacles knocked off. The group grasps the Crone.  Masbath stands on his chair, clutching the ledger.  Ichabod grabs one man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? The man slams Ichabod back. Magnification spectacles are crushed under foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry men carry the corpse to a raging bonfire.  The mob makes way.  Steenwyck cheers them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her burn!  Let her burn! Ichabod comes out, followed by Young Masbath.  The Crone' corpse is thrown in the fire.  Cheers all around. At Ichabod's side, a man tries to grab the ledger Young Masbath holds.  Young Masbath cries out, hanging on to th book.  Ichabod joins the struggle. Katrina watches, emotions conflicting. Other men grab Ichabod.  One punches Ichabod in the face. Katrina rides forward as Baltus calls for her to stop. Katrina leaps down, into the crowd, pulls men off Ichabod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop this!  Leave them alone! A SHOT RINGS OUT.  Chaos halts.  Everyone turns, quieting The men around Masbath and Ichabod turn to face Brom Bone Brom holds a smoking pistol, flanked by Theodore and Glen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them go (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to beat an orphaned child, imbecile? Masbath is released, along with the ledger.  Steenwyck mo forward, pushing people aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Ichabod Crane's protector, Brom Bones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You side with him in this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I agree he has only made matters worse.  But, that will change, if you listen. He trades with Theodore, pistol for a long rifle.  Brom h the rifle, taking a round slug from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore, Glenn and I offer to ride each day and night to watch over the Hollow.  We will stalk the border of the Western Woods and haunt the Horseman for a change, with rifles like this... and slugs like this... Brom brings the slug to his lips, blows.  It WHISTLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
