dialogues.text: Hollowed out and filled with powder. Brom smiles at Katrina, who watches unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable Crane is not the only one who fights with science on his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fired upon the Horseman and the bullet did nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have missed your mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hit him square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the crowd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say... if the Horseman is solid enough to take the lives of our people, he's solid enough to feel this... Brom aims the rifle at a BARREL down the road.  FIRES. PLUNK -- the barrel is hit -- EXPLODES.  Smoke wafts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In bed, Ichabod is having unpleasant dreams once more. FREAKISH WOMAN (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night of the great storm, I saw her cross my windows.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: Young Ichabod is seated beside Father, eyes tearful.  We back in the court where Mother stands trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lightning, I did see her. (points to Mother)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her. Lady Crane... I will never forget it.  The next moment, I found my infant son was dead, with the blood welt on his breast. The evil Third Man turns to a jury of TWELVE MEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have heard it.  The blood welt is the mark of Satan's touch. As the crowd murmurs in fear, Young Ichabod looks to Fath who sits with hands clenched, emotionless.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: In the quiet kitchen, Young Ichabod looks across the tabl Father stares into his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was with me, father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing can be done against them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was with me that night. Father doesn't even look up.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: Empty church.  Young Ichabod carries a lantern past pews. soldier is seated near the altar with a rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see her? The soldier exits through a white door.  Young Ichabod wa looking up at the vast church.  The white door opens and Third Man steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see my mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not want to be here.  Go home to your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did not do it... please listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir, please... she is innocent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has confessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has admitted to her evil and signed a written confession.  Do you know what confession is? (off Ichabod's nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that is left for you now is to pray for her soul. The Third Man leaves through the white door.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: Young Ichabod buttons his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: Young Ichabod comes out, looks to the lawn, not understanding.  Father loads a wagon full of belongings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are leaving. (long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has gone away. Realization comes to Young Ichabod.  He runs, away across lawn as Father calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: Young Ichabod runs, weeping. THIRD MAN (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has confessed.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: Empty.  Doors are thrown open and Young Ichabod enters. goes down the aisle, towards the white door. THIRD MAN (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has admitted to her evil and signed a written confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother.

dialogues.speaker: ICHABOD'S DREAM
dialogues.text: Young Ichabod enters, halting.  The room contains TORTURE DEVICES: iron cuffs, thumb screws, knifes and needles. THIRD MAN (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what confession is? He walks, numb, eyes locked forward... In the corner is a SPIKED CHAIR, adorned with sharp iron spikes.  Hundreds of spikes.  It is fitted with straps fo holding down the "accused." Tears stream down Young Ichabod's face.  He kneels, hands the spikes of the chair, pressing hard. As he sobs, blood runs down from his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In bed, Ichabod opens tear filled eyes.  He sits up, brin his trembling hands to wipe his cheeks.  His hands trail blood. He looks to them... The old scars are bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina comes to the door.  Ichabod is seated by the fire eyes bleary, palms wrapped with bloodied cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable Crane? Katrina comes beside Ichabod's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allow me some time.  I have spent every hour in the company of others. I need to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What troubles you? She moves in front.  Ichabod gets up and crosses to sit facing away.  Katrina takes the chair he deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The things I said to you before... I was wrong to say them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, actually, you were not.  Every word you spoke had truth in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What has happened? Ichabod sits silent, puts his head back, eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Van Tassel... she is your stepmother, isn't she?  She bears so little resemblance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is not your birth mother, is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but... why do you ask that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your mother?  Is she still alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She died.  Her lungs were diseased... two years ago.  What is this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Memories have come back.  I had them forgotten, and wish I could forget them again... but they are here now.  (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, how I hate this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want me to go, I will.  Do you want me to leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I do not know.  I no longer know what I think or what I feel. Katrina walks to him.  She touches his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so afraid of that?  Is there truly such harm in uncertainty? She kneels, smiles a little for him.  She reaches to touc his face, holds his head in her hands.  Leans to kiss him He rests his head against hers, weary, putting his arms around her.  They kiss passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn light, is visible over forests pounded by rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod exits his room, satchel in hand.  He looks down t hall, then steps back in to take a white rose from a vase AROUND A CORNER, Ichabod comes to the last door.  He bend slipping the white rose under the crack of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain.  Ichabod comes out.  Across the lawn, Young Masbath bringing the horses. LADY VAN TASSEL (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morrow, Constable. Ichabod turns to see Lady Van Tassel in a chair, sewing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Returning to the Western Woods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use caution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, studies her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know... I think those are the first words I have heard from you my entire time here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As my husband says, a wife should be always like an echo, and at the same time, quite unlike an echo. (off Ichabod's confusion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like an echo, she should speak only when spoken to, and unlike an echo, should never try to have the last word, or, at least that is what he believes. Baltus comes out the door, irritable, skillet in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable... did you notice anything out of the ordinary during the night? Ichabod eyes the skillet, ill at ease, trying not to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... I... I did not... no.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah has gone missing... my servant girl.  Her things are gone.  Damn it. She has joined the migration out of town. (to Lady Van Tassel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about breakfast, woman?  Or, am I to starve to death? Lady Van Tassel gets up and goes in, taking the skillet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be going... good day to you. Ichabod heads towards Young Masbath.  Baltus watches from porch, disgruntled.  He goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy rain.  Ichabod and Young Masbath ride side by side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the Crone's wound bled hard, that means she was not killed by the Hessian.  Someone only tried to make it look that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You grow sharper by the minute, little man.  It boggles my mind, but I begin to prefer your company over all others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I'm one of the few people who likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, who murdered the Old Crone?  And why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good questions, deserving answers, of which we are in short supply. A SOUND is HEARD.  Ichabod looks back, then to Masbath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quicken pace. Ichabod rides faster.  Young Masbath keeps up. FURTHER ON, they charge over a hill.  Ichabod halts Gunpo and climbs clumsily off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ride on. Young Masbath obeys.  Ichabod takes out his pistol and wa into forest growth, backtracking. INSIDE THE FOREST, Ichabod bounds through underbrush, low HORSE is HEARD SNORTING.  He pushes through branches... Moving behind a FIGURE IN A GREY CLOAK on horseback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt and turn.  I have a pistol aimed at your head. The figure stops, pushes off the cloak hood.  Katrina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is only me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina.  Why do you follow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize if I worried you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman should not be out alone in these woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I am not alone, am I?  I only wished to see what you were up to, and... (takes out WHITE ROSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To thank you. Ichabod softens, but doesn't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raining still.  Ichabod, Masbath and Katrina come into a clearing, mouths falling open at the sight of... A monstrously huge TREE OF THE DEAD, at the clearing's center, with branches reaching far and wide, knotted and gross, like agony captured in wood sculpture. Ichabod dismounts, crossing a line beyond which grass and weeds will not grow.  Young Masbath and Katrina dismount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right... it does draw attention to itself. Ichabod stares up into the endless, dead canopy of branch He circles the incredibly wide trunk. There's a VERTICAL WOUND in the bark, as if the tree once a terrible vertical in it, now partially healed and disgustingly scarred.  Ichabod approaches. He feels the mushy scar, picking at its scabs till much s begins to trickle. It is red and Ichabod fingers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say? Ichabod goes to where Katrina and Masbath wait with the horses, digs in a saddle bag for a hand axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back. At the trunk, Ichabod thumps the flat end of the axe agai the suture.  It sounds hollow.  Ichabod begins to chop. He pulls away loose bark.  The tree drips more blood and clear goo.  Ichabod uses both hands on the axe to hack at festering suture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just... keep where you are. Ignoring, Young Masbath moves closer.  Ichabod keeps chopping, then grips a large, loose flap of wood, trying bend it.  It's not easy.  Ichabod struggles. Katrina follows Masbath's slow advance. Ichabod's pulling... the flap suddenly gives, revealing a blood-soaked, wide-eyed, gap-mouthed HUMAN HEAD. Ichabod recoils.  Behind him, Katrina stifles a scream, taking Young Masbath in her arms to keep him from looking It is Philipse's head, hanging off the trunk flap, held b roots grown around and into the flesh. Ichabod reapproaches, back of his hand to his mouth. FOUR other SEVERED, DECAYING HEADS are held by ingrown ro within the dewy innards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God... what has happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He... he tries to take the heads... they will not pass. He looks to the branches towering above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be some sort of gateway.  But, why this place... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why this tree? Ichabod begins looking at the ground, moving around the t He gets to his knees, pushing mud away. Uncovering a flush HEADSTONE carved with "666."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Climb down to the Horseman's soulless place." (to Masbath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the shovel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain.  Young Masbath's crouched, muddy, rifle across his knees.  He's watching the tree. Behind him, Katrina climbs out of the shallow grave near pile of mud.  Ichabod hands up the shovel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Masbath, we've found it. Young Masbath goes to the grave.  Ichabod pulls at thick burlap cloth, straining as it comes away. Ichabod looks down, disbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It cannot be true. WE SEE: roots have gripped the Horseman's bones and tatte uniform.  The skeleton is all there -- except the skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it every grave I open holds a new mystery inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skull is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I did notice that, thank you. Ichabod climbs out, weary in body and spirit.  LIGHTNING. THUNDER.  He stares at the bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is his silent shrieking... and his desire, to reclaim his head. Ichabod turns, looking to the bordering forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "He who holds fast the Horseman's desire will guide his reaping hand."  (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone controls the Horseman. KATRINA (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod! Ichabod turns, looks... Katrina and Young Masbath back away, because the ROOTS in grave are ALIVE, further entwining around remains. Ichabod spins to the twisted tree... The vertical SUTURE SEETHES, pulling inwards... sucking Philipse's head back in and closing, bubbling. Ichabod bounds over grave dirt pile, hastening Katrina an Young Masbath along as he flees. At the tree, the suture swells. Ichabod, Katrina and Young Masbath pass where their freak horses are tied to a fallen trunk, heading for cover. A RUMBLING is HEARD from the twisted tree, which suddenly BURSTS wide, spitting smoldering cinders. At the tree line, Ichabod, Katrina and Young Masbath cowe looking back. From the tree wound, a glow brightens, till the Headless Horseman and Daredevil EXPLODE into existence... They hit the ground running. Ichabod watches the Horseman ride away with bolts of LIGHTNING STRIKING the GROUND BEHIND. The Horseman disappears in the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His next victim is chosen! (to Masbath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me distance, then guide her back to the Hollow. Ichabod runs towards the horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman rips past on Daredevil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod rides as fast as Gunpowder is able.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small home.  Killian, Thomas and Beth have finished suppe Beth clears plates as Killian picks his teeth with a knif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I be excused, father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you deserve to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shyly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, go. Thomas gets down from his chair.  He goes to the fireplac light a tallow wick, which he takes to the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas plops on the floor and lights his MAGIC LANTERN: a lantern with an outer sleeve of glass painted with silhouettes of lions and monsters. Thomas turns the lantern and looks to the walls where the creatures, shadows are thrown.  He roars for them, imagin them real and having a grand time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth comes for more dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pick teeth.  You teach Thomas bad habits. Killian pulls her to him, playful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a bad habit.  There's nothing for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kisses him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one knows better than I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas continues his fun, shadow animals circling him. In the shifting light, a baby spider comes from a crack i the wall.  Then, another spider skitters out.  More follo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black horse runs, hooves pounding the ground.  THUNDER HEARD.  The horse slows and stops... it is Brom's horse, Brom aboard.  Brom looks skyward. The storm harshens, roaring through the trees.  Distant HOOFBEATS can be HEARD.  POUNDING. Brom takes his rifle off his shoulder.  The HOOFBEATS gro LOUDER and PASS, far away.  Brom turns in the saddle and WHISTLES.  He kicks his horse and rides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas still watches shadow beasts, but sees something el He goes to the crack where hundreds of spiders flee all directions. Thomas is amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Killian, mantelpiece stones pulse, breathing almos imperceptibly.  Demonic faces form, then disappear and re again, shifting.  WIND HOWLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth enters, looking at Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing there? The magic lantern stops spinning.  Shadow creatures freez

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ENTIRE HOUSE CREAKS.  Killian looks up.  CREAKING STO The HOWLING WIND is LOUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth comes to Thomas' side as he points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spiders. Beth bends to see the swarming spiders.  She looks up, noticing the FEROCITY of the WIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killian stands, looking up.  The HOUSE CREAKS again, then suddenly the WIND CEASES.  Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth picks up Thomas.  The magic lantern creatures begin spinning anew, all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a ROAR, the fire flares.  Killian looks. WHHOOOSH the fire shoots up the fireplace.  Gone. Behind Killian, the DOOR SPLINTERS INWARDS.  The Horseman steps in, a battle axe in each hand.  WIND BLASTS... The DOOR to the other room SLAMS. Killian grabs a kitchen chair and hurls it at the Horsema The Horseman swings, smashing it aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth... run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth hugs Thomas to her as she backs away. KILLIAN (o.s.) (from kitchen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killian grabs an iron skewer from the fireplace, swings i fend off a blow from the Horseman. The Horseman swings the other axe.  Killian ducks.  The a cracks fireplace stone, throwing sparks. Killian lunges, jamming the skewer into the Horseman. The skewer comes through the Horseman's back.  The Horsem swipes with the flat of one axe -- pounding Killian aside Killian hits the wall, bashing his head.  Hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth kicks a carpet to reveal a trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman pulls the skewer out of his body, throws it. goes to lift Killian by the hair with one hand, brings ba the axe in the other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the trap door, Beth lowers Thomas to stairs leading to cellar.  Thomas is crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him get you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hide now... go... Beth closes the trap door, frantically replacing the carp The room's door flies open and the Horseman strides in, carrying Killian's severed head.  Beth shrieks. The Horseman steps forward, knocks over the magic lantern

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth's SCREAMS are abruptly CUT OFF.  Her BODY is HEARD HITTING the floor above.  Thomas crosses the cellar, stumbles.  He scurries into the shelter of a wheelbarrow propped against the wall.  FOOTSTEPS are HEARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman's hands place Killian's and Beth's heads in sack, cinching the sack shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Headless Horseman enters, bends to retrieve the battl axe he left.  He stands.  Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas' trembling hands pull the wheelbarrow closer.  QUI He tries to control his sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman turns, falls to his knees.  He starts to cho the floor with both axes.  CHOPping,  CHOPping,  CHOPping making quick work of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hole appears in the ceiling as debris falls. Thomas looks up, terrified.  He gets up to run away... The Horseman's arm shoves through above, grasping Thomas yanking him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brom rides from the forest, charging across Killian's fie At Killian's house, Daredevil rides up as the Headless Horseman walks out with his sack of heads.  The Horseman the sack to the saddle and leaps up. Brom puts his reins in his mouth, raising his rifle. The Horseman heads away, past the barn, as Brom gains. Brom aims... FIRES! BOOM -- the slug EXPLODES, blowing the Horseman off Daredevil.  Daredevil keeps going.  The Horseman's smolde body is left "face down." Brom halts his horse.  He climbs down, pleased. The Horseman moves. Brom backs away, satisfaction diminishing. The Horseman gets on his knees. Brom falls to one knee, begins reloading.  He fills the g from his powder horn. The Horseman stands, unsheathes his sword and turns.  The blast has blown apart his uniform at the chest and should exposing rotten flesh and maggot-infested muscle. Brom readies his ramrod, jamming powder in the barrel. The Horseman charges. Brom stands, pulling out the ramrod.  The Horseman is on Brom swings the rifle, blocking.  Sparks fly. The battle is on, with Brom fending off the Horseman's sw with the gun -- CLANK -- CLANK -- CLANK. ACROSS THE FIELD, Ichabod and Gunpowder break into the op UP THE FIELD, the Horseman makes a backhanded swing.  Bro goes down, his rifle sent flying. Brom rolls to avoid as the Horseman slashes. Brom flees.  The Horseman pulls and throws a knife... THWAP -- the knife imbeds in Brom's thigh. The Horseman runs towards Brom. Ichabod closes in, pulling an unlit lantern off his saddl Brom tries to get up, bends to extract the knife. The Horseman, mid-run, changes his sword grip, blade down He plants one foot on Brom's back, raising his sword, abo to skewer... Ichabod arrives full gallop, SMASHES the lantern into the Horseman -- knocking the Horseman off Brom. AT THE EDGE OF THE FOREST, Theodore and Glen arrive on horseback.  They hold a moment, watching. Brom runs, limping, to the barn, goal in sight: farm implements propped there.  Brom grabs SCYTHES with long curved blades, one in per hand. The Horseman rises. Ichabod turns Gunpowder and leaps off, runs to Brom. The Horseman moves towards them, hefting a battle axe in free hand.  Ichabod steps up, pistol aimed, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what it's worth... FIRES -- the bullet rips through the Horseman's stomach t reveal putrid innards as he keeps advancing. At the forest, Theodore looks to Glenn, turns and flees. Brom steps up, scythes ready.  He and the Horseman go at Brom blocks axe and sword, catching and deflecting blows. At the forest, Glenn follows Theodore away. Ichabod grabs a long handled SICKLE. Brom swings the scythes.  The Horseman avoids. Ichabod moves to the side, looking for an opening.  He sw the sickle. The Horseman blocks. The Horseman battles both at once, catching blows... countering every strike, METAL RINGING. Brom catches the Horseman's sword in one scythe, holding off.  Catches the axe handle in the other scythe. The Horseman flatfoot KICKS Brom's chest, sending him dow Ichabod swings the sickle blade... Hits the Horseman, the blade embedding to the hilt. The Horseman drops his axe and grasps the sickle, jerking The sickle handle SLAMS Ichabod's, knocking him away. Ichabod crawls, tries to shake off the blow. He looks up.  The Horseman staggers, spastically trying t pull the blade from his body. Brom limps to Ichabod, yanks him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cannot win this. They head towards the forest. Behind, the Horseman extracts the sickle, throws it.  He strides after them, picks up his axe on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Brom stumble down a hillside.  Brom points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There... They run to a DOCK at the edge of a wide, rapid river.  T jump into a FLAT BOAT barge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the front and guide it. Ichabod goes.  Brom uses a scythe to slash the ropes. Ichabod picks up a GUIDE POLE.  The barge lurches, set fr Ichabod struggles to push the boat out.  it moves swiftly caught in rain swollen current. Brom looks back.  No Horseman.  He leaves the scythe and moves to the front, hefting another pole to help guide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see him catch us now. Ichabod looks to the shore.  Horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. LIGHTNING ILLUMINATES -- ahead, the Horseman stands on th bank with Axe and sword.  Daredevil near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll pass right by the son of a bitch. Ichabod and Brom push with the poles, trying for speed. At the bank, the Horseman walks directly to the water... Just as he takes a step onto the water, the rain churned surface TRANSFORMS -- instantly BECOMING a SHEET of ICE.. SPREADING and supporting the Horseman as he advances. ICE SHOOTS OUT ahead of him, towards a point in the river where it will intercept the barge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Christ... The Horseman's ICE BRIDGE engulfs the barge, HALTING IT. Ichabod and Brom are thrown.  The barge is trapped. The Horseman nears. Brom runs to the rear to retrieve his scythe.  Ichabod ho up the only weapon he has, his guide pole. The Horseman steps on board.  Ichabod swings.  The Horsem axe cracks the pole in half... The Horseman thrusts with sword -- into Ichabod's chest - clean through.  It SIZZLES as Ichabod screams. The Horseman lifts Ichabod up, flips him, pulling the swo out as Ichabod goes... SMASHING through the ice and under. UNDERWATER: water carries Ichabod, slams him against ice above. He's pulled down by undertow. ABOVE WATER, beyond the edge of the ice bridge: Ichabod c up, gasping, choking on rain. He treads water, looking to the barge.

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE WATER
dialogues.text: Aboard the barge, the Horseman cuts Brom down... stands o him, chopping with sword.  Our VIEW grows BLURRY, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candlelight.  Ichabod, shirtless, feverish, opens his eye The wound at the top of his chest is raw.  Katrina insert needle in the skin around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay still, Ichabod.  Do not move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor, he is awake. Ichabod tries to sit.  Pain stops him.  Lady Van Tassel h bleed the wound with the needle and a tube leading to a SUCTION JAR of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely a voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what are you doing... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm drawing bad blood from the wound. Doctor Lancaster comes to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep still, Constable.  You were half-drowned when they found you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Brom Bones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is dead.  You would be also, if your wound had not somehow shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring Young Masbath here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need rest. Ichabod gives up, closes his eyes.  Katrina, needle in on hand, brings her other hand to hold Ichabod's. Blood drips into the suction jar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod is soundly asleep.  Across the room, Katrina is a his work table.  Ichabod stirs.  Katrina looks to him. Once she is satisfied he will not wake, she returns to wh she was doing, turning a page.  She is reading his ledger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Masbath lies awake.  A glint of light crosses the window.  Masbath looks to it, gets up, peers out. THROUGH THE WINDOW, he can see the Van Tassel Manor House the distance.  Lantern LIGHT crosses the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lantern light moves through the orchard, away from th house.  We cannot make out the person. Elsewhere, Young Masbath runs in pursuit.  He hides again one tree, leans to look... The light enters forest.  Young Masbath follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod's hurting.  Masbath helps with a shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone left last night.  Looked like they headed to the square, but I lost them in the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man or woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I saw was their lantern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business, best hidden is hidden best at night. Ichabod goes to his work table, organizing his satchel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If someone has the Horseman's skull... if they control the Horseman, then why haven't they sent him for your head yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, I serve a fine purpose alive. It is perfection for our murderer if I return to New York City with nothing more than tales of a galloping ghoul.  (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must uncover the reason these victims were targeted.  What was taken from them... other than their lives? Who benefits by their deaths? Ichabod fumbles the bottle of white powder. It bounces, cork popping out... rolls under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it. Ichabod kneels, pained.  A trail of the blood-detecting powder has spilled.  The bottle is out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it. Young Masbath gets down, ready to crawl for it, but Ichab stops him, peering under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... Far under, near the bottle, some powder is bubbling. Ichabod moves to the end of the bed and lifts, in pain.  Young Masbath helps. They drag the bed to one side. Under the bed: a Satanic PENTAGRAM has been DRAWN IN BLOO Ichabod stares, trying to grasp the implication.  Masbath about to speak, but Ichabod puts a finger to his lips. Ichabod moves to lock the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this? Ichabod does not answer.  He picks up a wash basin and du the water to wash the Pentagram away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAGONS, HORSES and TOWNSPEOPLE swarm.  A CROWD loots the town's general store.  Provisions are passed along man to and loaded on wheelbarrows. All up and down the long straight road, home owners board windows with lumber. Ichabod and Young Masbath ride, passing many angry faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panic has set in. They stop, tying their horses and climbing stairs to the of the "NOTARY."  Ichabod looks off... DOWN THE ROAD, at the far end, people head to the church. Much activity there as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanctuary.  Or, so they hope. Families put up tents all around the church within the bordering wrought-iron fence.  Supplies abound. People work to build and erect massive wooden crosses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tidy room.  Young Masbath watches Ichabod hand a slip of paper to the elderly Notary, Hardenbrook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have these persons' wills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have everything... last testaments... birth certificates, death certificates... deeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir... but, do you have these? Hardenbrook studies the paper with his one good eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly... certainly. Hardenbrook nods, handing the list back, grinning.  Ichab stands waiting.  Hardenbrook is still nodding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see them, Master Hardenbrook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?  See them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May we look at them now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  You want them... it shall not take long.  Wait here. Hardenbrook heads across the room.  Ichabod offers the li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fine idea. Hardenbrook takes it and exits.  Young Masbath sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To discover what might have been taken from those who died, it will help to know what was there that could be taken in the first place. Ichabod waits.  After a moment, he looks uncertain.  He crosses to the half-open door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod sticks his head in, not liking what he sees. Hardenbrook's amidst unbelievable disarray.  Tables, shel and baskets of unevenly piled documents. Hardenbrook looks on a shelf, confused, then goes to a ta lifting papers, mumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn... damn... damn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Hardenbrook... Hardenbrook turns, a bit startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps, I could assist in finding them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... that might be... helpful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardenbrook is asleep in a chair, snoring, blind eye open Ichabod and Young Masbath face official-looking documents with Ichabod focused on one will in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father had farm land.  It was the only thing we owned of any value.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it now belongs to you, according to Baltus.  I heard him say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Ichabod turns the will in his hand to Masbath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then look here at your father's will, and tell me why you are not listed. Young Masbath takes it, boggled.  Ichabod grabs another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Garrett had denoted his elder son in his last wishes; the same son murdered along with him.  But Van Garrett's wife and two infant children are not written... and they were spared. (picks up another will)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see?  Philipse had no family to bestow his farm to.  But, here... (picks up another)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Widow Windsor was listed on her late husband's will.  After her inheritance, she amended the document to include her bastard child.  This is why the Horseman made absolutely certain to impale the unborn descendant. Ichabod sits back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the heirs were killed.  Proof that the Horseman slaughters by assignment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, if the farm is not mine, who stole it away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one yet, far as I can tell.  It has gone intestate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In test... what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intestate.  Your farm... all the farms... they belong to no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it mean? Ichabod stares off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Often in such cases, property which has gone intestate legally passes to whomever the deceased was indebted to. And, who in this town is owed a great many debts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realization)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baltus Van Tassel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did your father take a loan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I rode with him on payment days. Ichabod stands, grim, gathering wills and his ledger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight, we answer questions.  And, to discover who moves about the Van Tassel house after dark... all we need is a candle. A LOUD NOISE is HEARD from the other room.  Ichabod looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod bursts in.  No one there.  A chair has been knock over and the front door is ajar.  Ichabod moves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod exits.  All around is the commotion in the square before.  No telling who it was who just fled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Masbath is seated, bored.  Ichabod writes in his ledger.  A KNOCK on the door.  They both look up. KATRINA (o.s.) (from outside door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable... are you there? (long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod? The knob is tried and found locked.  Pause.  At the botto the door, a red rose is passed under. This saddens Ichabod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet night.  The church is a sight, with a yard resembli an empty squatter's tent city, surrounded by crosses. Boarded over windows leak shafts of light. MOVING PAST THE WINDOWS: many eyes peer out from the slat UP IN THE BELFRY, TWO RIFLEMEN are on watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Masbath are in darkness, still waiting.  Icha takes the cover off a lantern, looks at a clock.  Midnigh straight up.  Ichabod stands, picks up an unlit candle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midnight seems an appropriate time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Young Masbath look out, cautious.  They move the nearest door. Ichabod crouches, using the candle to mark the seam of th door and door frame.  He's making a low, wax seal.  If th door opens, the seal will break. They move to a second door, quietly.  Ichabod makes anoth low wax mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Masbath come downstairs to a hall.  Ichabod continues his wax marking at each door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Young Masbath enter, shutting the door.  Icha walks to shelves at Baltus' desk, looks through ribbon bo DOCUMENTS and hands some to Masbath. Young Masbath pulls off the ribbon, pages through these " AGREEMENT" parchments.  Ichabod brings another pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are alphabetical. Young Masbath has the M's.  "MARYIE," "MEGAPOLENISIS," AN "MELYN..." Not finding what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no Masbath here.  My father's loan papers are missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding his documents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are none for Magistrate Philipse either.  "Paasch, James" "Pieter, Thomas" "Pos, William." A FLOORBOARD CREAKS.  Ichabod looks, blows out the lanter He and Young Masbath stand frozen. Across the room, light comes under the door, stops, then continues.  A DOOR is HEARD OPENING and SHUTTING.  Ichabo crosses to follow, pointing back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep looking.  Then, hide in my room and bolt the door till I return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lantern light moves, far ahead.  Ichabod follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod stops, hidden.  He can see the light ahead, but i no longer in motion.  He advances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lantern sits on a rock.  On a blanket, a semi-naked MAN semi-naked WOMAN are in the midst of rough SEX. Ichabod crawls to peer from underbrush. The couple keeps coupling, with the man on top.  His grun and gasps are particularly desperate.  He's all over the woman, who lays back... it is Lady van Tassel. Ichabod swallows, inches closer. Lady van Tassel pulls the man's shirt, exposes his flesh. She raises a small, sharp KNIFE behind his back. Ichabod's eyes widen. Lady Van Tassel brings the blade to her own hand, slicing deep in her palm.  Blood flows.  She rubs her cut hand ov her partner's arching back, smearing blood. Lady van Tassel caresses the man's chest, neck, face... trailing blood.  The man lifts his head, in ecstasy, suck the woman's bloody fingers... it's Clergyman Steenwyck. Ichabod backs away, having seen more than plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Masbath unlocks the door.  Ichabod enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was getting worried.  Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Van Tassel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something I really wish I had not seen. Never mind it.  Did you find the victims' loan agreements?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  They are all missing. This troubles Ichabod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is more, though.  While you were gone, I could hear someone else walking through the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Young Masbath creep round a corner.  Going to LAST DOOR, Ichabod crouches, eyes narrowing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers, to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina. The wax seal is broken, flecks of wax on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod and Masbath come downstairs, checking all the wax marks.  Young Masbath finds one broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Ichabod comes over, pushes the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter.  The kitchen is empty.  Ichabod crosses to another door, crouches.  Another broken wax mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter... the room with the elaborate loom.  Ichabod moves his lantern to make a quick search, goes to table. He touches the top of a candle.  His finger comes away wi bit of still wet wax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no other doors.  This is as far as she could have gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is nothing.  She comes to read books, so her father will not find her. (to convince himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is absolutely nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiction plays and novels.  Baltus does not approve.  Now, come.  It may not be long before Lady Van Tassel returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, sir... what books?  Where are they? Ichabod stops, looking around.  No books anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there is a secret place for books... it could be just as good for the missing loan agreements. Ichabod ponders this without saying anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Drawers are opened and searched, quietly. - Young Masbath uses a candle to look up the fireplace. - Ichabod opens a linen cabinet, unfolding blankets. - Young Masbath looks in a closet filled with big spools sewing thread, on his knees, pulls a wooden box forward. Inside it, he finds only old cups and silverware. Ichabod pulls up a rug, feeling along the floorboards. Young Masbath crawls, doing the same.  He climbs under th loom, tapping on the floor.  TAP... TAP... TAP... He crawls further under the loom.  TAP... TAP... PLONK. hollow sound.  He taps again... PLONK... PLONK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable. Ichabod comes over as Young Masbath lifts a loose board. Under the floor, there are piles of books.  Masbath bring them up, handing them to Ichabod, who studies the spines. Young Masbath reaches in up to his shoulder.  He comes up with "LOAN AGREEMENTS."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fie!  Here they are. Ichabod takes them.  Names are near the top: "Masbath," " Garret," "Philipse," and "Killian." Ichabod sits back, numb, his heart bitterly broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Van Tassel prepares food with two servants at the op fireplace/oven.  Ichabod enters, rushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Lady Van Tassel... Katrina is not in her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  She has gone out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has taken the last of our grain to be milled. (crossing to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do have a background in the medical arts, don't you, Constable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very little.  I must be going... Lady Van Tassel holds out her cut palm, the gash sewn shu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you look at this?  I cut my hand this morning: I sewed it myself, but I am afraid it will go bad. Ichabod takes her hand, distracted and nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears well.  It has already clotted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look closer.  Do you have anything to clean it with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is fine.  Now, I must... Lady Van Tassel grabs Ichabod by the wrist, tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering, close)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you saw me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... ? Lady Van Tassel glances to servants, keeps her voice low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you followed last night.  You must promise not to tell Baltus... Ichabod tries to pull away, but she grips tighter.  The F DOOR is HEARD SLAMMING.  Ichabod is panicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have mercy on me.  Please... have mercy. Ichabod pulls away just as Baltus enters.  Lady Van Tasse goes back to work as if nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constable, it is urgent that we speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baltus leads Ichabod to the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clergyman Steenwyck is calling a meeting.  This time he is determined to have you forced out, or worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you hear this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came to me.  He promised great violence.  Said I should cast you out for my own protection. (troubled pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must speak honestly.  There is no reason to think he will not meet with success. Ichabod looks to barn, sees Masbath bringing the horses. CHURCH BELL is HEARD TOLLING far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the meeting bell already calling.  With the murder of Killian and Brom, no one sees any good from you.  If... if you were to leave... you might be saving your own life. Ichabod studies Baltus, then offers his hand.  They shake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your concern.  I thank you, sir. Ichabod hurries off, across the lawn, exasperated.  He ru Masbath runs to him.  Ichabod takes Gunpowder and climbs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mounting his horse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?  Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things have become complicated. Katrina is at the mill.  Ride ahead, find her and bring her to meet me outside the church.  Find her at all costs.  Quickly. They ride, fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A conjuring pile of straw burns.  Gloved hands unfold a p filled with clippings of human hair.  The hair is sprinkl on the fire. A cloaked FIGURE is kneeled at the pile.  The figure turn remove A human SKULL from a cloth bag. The skull is placed at center in the flames.  It's teeth sharp, cut to points.  The HORSEMAN'S SKULL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the church yard refugee camp, food is prepared over fi People inhabit the tents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE CHURCH: it's crowded with families.  Pews filled w bedding and belongings.  Steenwyck comes to CLOSE the DOU DOORS of his quarters, turning, angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are astonishing, Constable.  Do you truly think your ridiculous accusations frighten me? Ichabod is doing nothing to hide his disdain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if I repeat them outside this room.  And, I will if I must... (points to doors)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out there, for all to hear.  Or... you may speak, as planned.  But, you tell them you feel compelled to move on to greener pastures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You will not run me out.  No one will believe a word of what you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?  Far as I can tell, a rumor does not travel alone for long here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a deist?  Is that it?  A free thinker who does not believe in divinity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is only important what you are. An adulterer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the Lord's voice in this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallowing in sin and lust...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They need guidance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallowing quite literally in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping, quaking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you, sir!  God damn you to hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may.  But, not soon enough for you, and not on your behalf. Ichabod walks.  Steenwyck is humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so upset now... and yet, you seemed in such good spirits last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot do this.  I am a man of God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climb to the top of the tallest ladder you can find, Father.  That is the closest you ever come to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pews are packed.  Steenwyck enters, walks to the altar. EVERYONE QUIETS.  Steenwyck has composed himself, barely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends... dear friends.  Those of you still on your farms, I thank you for coming. He sees Ichabod near the back.  THUNDER is HEARD OUTSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I address unfortunate business.  (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am forced to take my leave from Sleepy Hollow.  I will be moving on to do the Lord's work elsewhere. The GATHERERS MURMUR shock.  Ichabod walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raining hard.  Baltus and Lady Van Tassel ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry along.  The meeting has most certainly already begun.  We do not want Steenwyck as our enemy. Lady Van Tassel trails.  WOOD is HEARD SPLINTERING... Just off the road, a tree falls... The trunk catches Lady Van Tassel's horse on its rear fla The horse falls.  Lady Van Tassel hits the dirt. Baltus looks back, halting. Lady Van Tassel looks up to Baltus in fear, then turns. Behind her, the Headless Horseman trots from, the forest Daredevil, stops.  Calm.  He takes his axe in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storming.  The meeting is letting out.  Near the churchya gate, Young Masbath rides with Katrina following on a hor cart.  Ichabod walks up as Katrina dismounts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is so urgent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. Ichabod leads her to where they can talk away from others

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have I not seen your face for so long?  You look much better. She touches his face, but he takes her hand, places the l agreements there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain these.  I found them secreted away in the sewing room. Katrina's expression changes just so slightly to guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why... why have I scrambled and run and clawed in all directions, only to find you against me? He stares at her.  Katrina stares back, in a small way defeated.  She looks for an out, but there is none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been reading your journal. I'm sorry.  I found it too fascinating to resist.  (pause, ashamed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rode to catch up with you at the Notary, out of curiosity.  Before I found you though, I overheard what you were said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When... when you spoke father's name along with accusations, I could not believe it.  I had to hide these... at least till I could confront him myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, what did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did not do these things.  If you knew him, you would realize...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say, Katrina?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have not been able to face him yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The loans give the land to your father. It does not matter survivors are still on their farms.  They could be thrown off... tomorrow... a year from now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I have seen that, and I told you why I hid them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you have me believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tiring, angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think I am behind this, say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name Van Tassel is blackened.  You share that name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me a liar, then, and a murderess. Say it, out and out. Many people are starting to notice the confrontation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak the words, Constable.  What is stopping you?  What has happened to your ability to transcend sentimentality? Emotions tear at him.  Rain seems to pound down harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.  No.  Please... don't dare stand looking as if you still care for me, after all that you have said.  If I were to confess, would that ease your suffering?  Would that make it easier for you to hate me?! A TORTURED CRY is HEARD O.S. Baltus comes charging through the square on his horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman is coming! He's barely hanging on.  He stops, practically falling of running towards Katrina and Ichabod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed her... Baltus grasps Katrina, fearful.  HOOFBEATS are HEARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman has killed her. Far behind, the Horseman rides to follow, axe held up. Instant mayhem -- people scatter all directions, screamin Baltus runs headlong to the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father! Katrina runs after Baltus.  Ichabod backs away, watching Horseman come, then heads to the church with Masbath. Baltus pushes through the iron gate, into tent city, join the swarm of townsfolk pouring into the church. The Horseman rides behind, closing the gap.  Men, women a children run for cover all along the square. Amidst the churchyard panic, Ichabod looks back... The Horseman reaches the open gate and Daredevil suddenly rears up, snorting, unwilling to enter. The Horseman grabs Daredevil's reins, tries to move forwa again.  Same result.  Daredevil freaks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baltus makes his way in, shoving.  People are still clamo in through the doors. Men pass rifles from stockpiles and climb onto pews at boarded windows.  Women herd children into a cellar. Baltus searches for a hiding place.  He looks across the church to see Steenwyck closing the doors of his living quarters.  Baltus moves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steenwyck! At the front doors, Katrina squeezes in with Ichabod and Young Masbath just as people are forcing the doors closed It's madness.  People outside begin pounding. Katrina searches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father! Ichabod goes to a window, looking out between boards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the yard, the Horseman gives his axe an underhand to the ground inside the gate. The AXE instantly BEGINS TO DEGRADE TO DUST in the rain. The Horseman rides, keeping outside the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod comes away from the window, looking to panicked citizens.  He sees Katrina moving up the aisle... She's heading towards Baltus, who slams against the door Steenwyck's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you, Steenwyck!  Help me! Let me in! RIFLES BOOM LOUDLY as men at the windows begin firing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman circles, under fire. Great clouds of gun smoke shoot from the church. Men fire down from the belfry. Parts of the Horseman and Daredevil splatter red into the rain as slugs hit without effect. AT THE OTHER SIDE OF THE CHURCH, the Horseman comes aroun heading to the town square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rifleman shout to each other, running to the opposite win to follow the Horseman. Young Masbath grabs a rifle and leaps to join the brigade Baltus is still beating Steenwyck's door when a HUGE FARM grips Baltus angrily and throws him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll kill us all! Baltus falls, knocking over pews.  Katrina's nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one the Horseman wants. Why should we die for you!?

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: The huge farmer picks Baltus up, dragging him and shoving Katrina aside as she approaches. Ichabod's pushing past people, trying to reach them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman brings Daredevil to a halt, yanking a large of ROPE off a hitching post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge farmer shoves Baltus to the floor again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out! Others join the rage, pulling Baltus towards the front of church, shouting.  Ichabod struggles to push them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop this! Ichabod gets to Baltus' side, trying to protect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman cannot enter!  It does not matter who he wants, he cannot cross the gate! At the windows, ONE RIFLEMAN turns, crying out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming back! More panic.  The huge farmer moves towards Baltus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to save ourselves! Baltus pulls the pistol from Ichabod's holster, brandishi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Get away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman rides past the front, fired upon. He halts at the wrought iron gate, reaching to yank off o POST which is pointed on top, like an arrow head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baltus holds everyone's back with the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next person to lay hands on me will have a bullet.  Stand off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  We're safe here. (points at Ichabod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it.  The Horseman will not have me. CRASH, the harpoon-like post SPEARS through a window, trailing rope tied to it... CRACK -- SKEWERS Baltus from behind, the bloodied point bursting out his breast bone. Baltus looks down, drops the gun... clutching the post wi both hands.  Blood streams out his mouth.  Katrina scream The rope yanks Baltus back.  He SLAMS into the WINDOW...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baltus CRASHES out, hits the ground, dragged... Outside the fence, Daredevil runs with the rope tied arou his saddle pommel.  The Horseman strides forward, sword o Baltus SLAMS the fence and the rope snaps.  He is held th awkwardly, gurgling blood. The Horseman reaches Baltus... chops off his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm has passed.  Empty forest.  Long, peaceful paus till Ichabod makes his way through, searching the ground. Ichabod comes to look down a small hill.  The corpse of L Van Tassel lies headless, in a dirty, torn dress. Ichabod walks to the body.  Lady Van Tassel's arm is twis behind.  The sewn cut on the palm of her hand faces up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here!  I have found her... (looking at corpse, quiet and miserable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Lancaster comes out from where Katrina is asleep. closes the door, wipes his sweaty face.  Ichabod waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has been a terrible jolt to her nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will stay at her side? Doctor Lancaster nods.  Ichabod walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting dark.  Ichabod comes out and crosses the por A few of the Hollow's residents are here.  Young Masbath up and follows Ichabod onto the lawn. Ichabod walks without waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the one who controlled the Horseman, isn't she, sir?  Sir?  (no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need time for thinking.  Without you hanging on my coattails for a change. Ichabod keeps walking.  Young Masbath stops, wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod stands holding a torch, looking up.  The whole ar is bright from the light off a giant fire. There are broken lanterns and barrels around the agonized twisted tree.  The tree is aflame, fire dancing up the tr and through every branch to lick the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn.  Ichabod is seated overlooking the Hudson.  He star at the beauty around him, brooding through bleary eyes. Gunpowder is tied to a tree.  BIRDS SING. The ledger is open in Ichabod's lap.  He thumbs pages absently, just keeps staring off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire burns in a circle of rocks.  Ichabod's ledger is thrown in.  The pages catch quickly. Ichabod watches, then walks away.  He's about to climb on Gunpowder, but on second thought he opens his satchel and digs out a BOOK.  He walks back to the fire, throws it on "Romeo and Juliet."  Flames devour it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clearing is silent.  The twisted tree still stands, smoldering, impressive as ever, or perhaps even more so w the alien appearance its blackened skin now affords it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod packs up baggage.  Young Masbath is miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't you change your mind, sir? What can I say to convince you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  To hell with this place and all the people here. Ichabod closes a bag, throws it with others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why... why are you like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause, softening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not know all that has happened. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coach, with Gunpowder as one of its team, waits in the orchard.  Van Ripper comes to meet Ichabod and Masbath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half now.  Half when we reach the city. Ichabod hands Van Ripper money.  Van Ripper takes the baggage.  Ichabod looks to the Manor House.  Only one lig shines, in a second floor window. Katrina can be seen there a moment as she closes curtains Ichabod turns to Young Masbath, who is beginning to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me with you.  There's nothing left for me here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot. (bends to Masbath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should not worry. (pause, sorrow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Ripper and his wife will look after you.  They will.  You will be well cared for. Young Masbath hugs.  Ichabod hugs back, swallowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry. (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me.  I failed you. Ichabod releases and goes quickly away, finding this mise unbearable.  He climbs in the coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not go, Constable.  How can you leave? INSIDE THE COACH, Ichabod slumps back in darkness and clo his eyes.  He pounds twice on the coach wall. OUTSIDE, Van Ripper whips the reins.  The coach starts. Young Masbath follows.  The coach picks up speed on the l straight road. Young Masbath stops, wiping tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod's coach moves through the town square.  A few peo in the churchyard's tent city come out to watch it pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is pushed open.  Young Masbath enters, looks aro the empty room.  He goes to sit in a chair at the work ta crossing his arms and resting his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plate of food sits untouched.  Katrina is slumped down chair, heartbroken, staring into the fireplace. Behind her, a shadow moves across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Ripper leads the coach through the stone pillars mark the entrance of Sleepy Hollow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod takes off his hat, sets it on the seat.  The wind between him and the driver slides open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... this is yours. (offering something)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Van Tassel girl said to give it to you after you were gone. Ichabod takes it.  It is the bird/cage spinning toy.  He studies it.  What melancholy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina sits with her eyes closed.  A BOARD is HEARD CREAKING.  She sits up. Suddenly, a FIGURE in black is be her as she turns.  WHACK! -- a gloved fist strikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dull THUD is HEARD downstairs, like a body falling.  Yo Masbath takes notice.  He moves to the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod turns the strings on the bird/cage toy, ponders i The paper disk spins, images flickering until the bird appears to be inside the cage. Ichabod keeps spinning it, looks out the window. A tear rolls down his cheek. The bird cage toy's rotation slows... stops. Ichabod looks at it a long moment, then pockets it and le forward to the window at front.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE COACH
dialogues.text: Ichabod's face appears behind Van Ripper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Ripper, turn the coach about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around.  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young        Masbath comes down the stairs, looking aroun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Katrina? Masbath starts down a hall.  He does not see, in another room, Katrina's body is dragged across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach comes to Lancaster's.  Ichabod climbs out befor even stops fully, satchel in hand.  He hurries...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Lancaster, half asleep, comes to answer BANGING on door.  Ichabod pushes past, taking Lancaster's lantern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon the intrusion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod enters.  There are two coffins on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never examined these bodies. Ichabod removes the lid from one coffin.  Lancaster is ab to say something indignant, but then just looks disgusted

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... help yourself, you pompous ass. I will be in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you stay, doctor?  I may need assistance. Lancaster reluctantly remains.  Ichabod stares at the dea Lady Van Tassel.  The neck wound is covered by a stained brown cloth, which Ichabod unwraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stains of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What of it? Ichabod takes out one of the lenses that survived the magnification spectacles, bends to examine the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jagged flesh.  (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman did not do this. Ichabod moves to the side of the coffin, lifting the hand with the stitched gash on its palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Doctor.  Hold this just so... Lancaster holds the lens so that Ichabod can study the cu through it.  Ichabod takes a scalpel-like knife from his satchel, lifts the hand and cuts stitches. THROUGH THE LENS: the gash spreads easily, soft, bloodles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No clotting or gathering of pus.  No healing at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this cut was made, this person was already dead. (stands straight)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not Lady Van Tassel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Masbath enters.  The door swings shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina. (steps forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyone here? Behind him, the door SLAMS open -- Lady Van Tassel reache grab Young Masbath by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod charges up to the church doors, pounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door.  Open up, damn it! (pounds, shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady van Tassel is alive.  The Horseman is her puppet.  Please...  The door opens and Huge Farmer points a rifle at Ichabod. Frightened people peer out from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't we rid of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me.  Lady Van Tassel has faked her death.  I need able men...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead, and you have gone mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steps forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!  Isn't it enough that you have ruined this town?  Go! Ichabod backs away from the gun, frustrated, runs... At the DOCTOR'S RESIDENCE, Van Ripper is still on the coa Ichabod sprints over, breathless, taking out his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Ripper... do you have a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Here... Van Ripper hold up a rifle.  Ichabod holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see it? Van Ripper's confused, but hands the rifle over.  Ichabod immediately points his pistol at Van Ripper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down.  Hurry! Van Ripper climbs off.  Ichabod climbs up, whips the hors

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Van Ripper watches the coach leave, still with his hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a wooded area, Katrina lies unconscious.  Gloved hands reach to her hair and cut off a clump with SCISSORS. A conjuring pile has been made, containing a small animal heart with an iron nail through it.  Katrina's hair is ad and the pile is lit to burn. Nearby, Young Masbath watches, on his belly with his hand tied behind his back. Lady Van Tassel whispers over the fire, her white horse t nearby.  She looks to Katrina, who stirs. Lady Van Tassel takes the Horseman's skull from a bag ove her shoulder, places the skull in the flames.  THUNDER is HEARD.  Lady Van Tassel looks up, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind tosses leaves in swirls.  The twisted tree opens wide, with a RUMBLE -- shafts of light shooting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod drives the coach hard ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina sits up, groggy.  Lady Van Tassel looks down at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... you are alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I?  Or, are you and Young Masbath dead along with me? Katrina sees Young Masbath, and beyond him, the dying fir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She commands the Horseman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, quite beautifully done, wouldn't you say?  It is almost over. THUNDER again.  Wind starts to pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of the wind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rides tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father saw you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He saw me thrown... saw the Horseman looming over me as I fled.  Things I wanted him to see.  But, as long as I govern the Horseman, he cannot harm me.  Baltus did not stay enough to see that.  He ran as a coward, unfettered by my fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, whose body was it... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The precious servant girl Sarah.  I killed her and kept her body hidden, till I needed it.  And, when I return to the Hollow tomorrow, my version of the truth will come to pass.  (faking meekness)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, there I was that fateful day, following Baltus into the woods.  I did not know what he was up to... where he was going.  I worried for his safety. Katrina cautiously moves the hand she's supporting hersel with, feels a rock and clutches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine my surprise, finding him on a liason with a common servant.  A girl who had apparently become his secret love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one will believe your lies, whore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whore will see your mouth shut forever very soon.  But... I am not going to kill you.  Not me... She picks up the Horseman's skull in her gloved hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will have that honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horseman rides Daredevil, a freight train of molderin flesh, heading towards a chasm with no bridge. They reach it, galloping in mid-air to the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod guides the coach into the Van Tassel orchard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Van Tassel admires the skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock sorrow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woe is me... that spying on my husband in his filthy indiscretion, I saw he and Sarah attacked by the Horseman. Oh pity me... so overcome was I that I wandered in the Western Woods... dazed... nearly blind from terror. Lady Van Tassel crouches, rubbing dirt on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, tomorrow is my grand performance, having barely survived the elements... (more emoting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By sheer luck I found my way back to the Hollow.  But... what do I find here... ?  My dear, sweet step-daughter Katrina is dead.  Why has God forsaken her? Seeing that Lady Van Tassel lavish attention on Katrina, Masbath takes this opportunity to ease onto his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of herself, pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one will suspect this sad woman who has been through such an ordeal.  With only the empty solace of her money and land to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichabod leaps from the coach, bounds up the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ICHABOD is HEARD.  Lady Van Tassel turns, astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
